title: Jesús Nogueiras
text:
Jesús Nogueiras Santiago (born in <a href="Santa%20Clara%2C%20Cuba">Santa Clara, Cuba</a>, July 17, 1959) is a Cuban chess <a href="Grandmaster%20%28chess%29">grandmaster</a>. He was a <a href="Candidates%20Tournament">World Championship Candidate</a> in 1985, finishing 2nd at the <a href="World%20Chess%20Championship%201987%231985%20Interzonal%20tournaments">Taxco 1985 Interzonal</a>, but 15th out of 16 at the <a href="World%20Chess%20Championship%201987%231985-87%20Candidates%20Tournament">1985 Candidates Tournament</a>.
Major tournament victories include winning the <a href="Cuban%20Chess%20Championship">Cuban Chess Championship</a> five times (1977 (tie), 1978, 1984 (tie), 1991, and 2000) the <a href="Capablanca%20Memorial">Capablanca Memorial</a> in 1984 and the <a href="Torre%20Memorial">Torre Memorial</a> in 1997.
